result.execSummary:
The defendant Joan L. Mulhollam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted payment plan on this case and on case 16CT85 of $25.00 per month to begin 4/1/2017

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Case 16CM179 is dismissed and read into this case.

by defendant to amend bond

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Joan L. Mulhollam, appeared in custody via video from the Clark County Jail pro se.  Court grants amendement to Signature bond to allow third party contact to retrieve personal belongings not more than 3 times.
Initial appearance on August 18, 2016 at 09:10 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with R.P.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  
AMENDED 7/11/16 at 3:36 pm.  Defendant may make arrangements through a third party to retrieve personal belongings but may not exceed 3 times.
AMENDED 8/18/2016  The no contact is lifted and  changed to no violent or otherwise disorderly contact with R.P.

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Joan L. Mulhollam, appeared in custody via video from the Clark County Jail pro se.  Signature bond $500 ordered with conditions.    Defendant advised of right to an attorney.    Defendant will seek an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 09:10 am.
